reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Grand Pacific Spa King room which was great, very spacious & nicely decorated. They should put more pictures of the rooms on their website as they are lovely. Amazing views. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate dinner here which was reasonably priced. Only a 10 minute walk into the main shops(along the beach at low tide was lovely). HIghly recommend
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, lovely location

reviews.text: We went here only for a meal (so didn;t stay) with a last minute booking for 40 people (booked 2 hours before) the day after a wedding. The staff were fabulous and accommodating. The meal was great in terms of taste and value. A definite must if you want a meal that is better than a usual pub meal but at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Nothing was too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived just as it was getting dark, lovely lights around the balcony, warm friendly welcome, amazing views, the bistro, omg the food was so fantastic still talking about it now
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful stay

reviews.text: Would love to come back again one day
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel in a quiet town

reviews.text: This is a perfectly situated hotel in Lorne. However you do need a car to go into the centre. It is on the wate and it is so peaceful. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and hada great night's sleep. We ate in the hotel's restaurant as places in town were closed. We made the right choice. The food was delicious and great value.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning to stay in Lorne.
reviews.title: One of the Best hotels we have ever stayed in!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at a 2 bedroom apartment. The rooms are a little dated but clean. We found it a little weird to have the 2 bedrooms downstairs but the kitchen and the living room upstairs. There is a washer and a dryer in the bathroom. They even provided 2 packs of laundry detergents which was very nice. But we couldn't figure out how to turn the heater on (We thought we had turned it on but no heat was generated) so we were freezing cold at night. Also, this is the only hotel during our Australia trip (7 hotels in all) that did not have any international power adaptor which we found very inconvenient (We were relying on the Google Map on my iPad for driving directions and it needed a charge). They were not open early enough for our early 7am checkout (but no checkout instructions the night before) so we were not able to settle it with cash as planned (trying to avoid the 3% foreign transaction fee). Location wise, it's a bit far from town to get food (most are closed at night anyway) but there's a pier (I think) at the beach right across the street. Overall, the hotel is okay but not as good as the other ones we've stayed during our trip.
reviews.title: It's Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely old colonial architecture with large rooms and an airy feel, but because it is so old it is a bit jaded in places. Big comfy bed and nice toiletries in our Spa room. The restaurant was good and the staff really friendly and welcoming. The view from window and balcony was great looking over towards Lorne. Shame they don't do breakfast, only at weekends. Free internet access.
reviews.title: Nice old Hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently visited the Grand Pacific Hotel Lorne and were pleasantly surprised with the excellent service and welcoming sense of humour of all the staff. The hotel room, although small, was clean and well maintained with a good sized modern bathroom. The wonderful views from the top hotel balconies (for guests only) more than made up for the size of the room and we were able to watch the sunset over a quiet bottle of wine and a comfortable chair. The kitchen has provided some interesting combinations on the menu. Our favourites were the lamb back straps and ling fish accompanied by roast beetroot with a lovely marinade. Thank you guys for the consistently good service, it is rare these days and you should be commended.
reviews.title: Great service with a smile and a wink.

reviews.text: We stayed in a 3 bed apartment ( booked and paid for a 2 bed) with great views across the Ocean and the pier in Lorne. Service was excellent, dinner in the restaurant great quality, value and served with attention to detail and great sense of humour. Coffee was perfect ( always important to us and unexpected as most places don't get it right........ probably one of the best cups I"ve ever had.) We paid $160 for a 3 bed apartment for one night with a $50 voucher thrown in for the hotel restaurant. Add to this the beautiful interior of the hotel for photographs, an invitation for my daughter to play and sing at the piano during checkout and a Welsh flag outside ( alongside Australian and Irish.) The manager adores and is passionate about rugby union ( we are originally from Wales) what more could we ask for for during a whistlestop stay? Can I find any suggestions for improvement? Well if I did it would involve inappropriate upgrades and turning this little beauty into something it isn't. Some people may think it needs a swimming pool or day spa or complain about something or other, people always do. We thought the whole experience was perfect and have stayed everywhere from 5* worldwide to Thai hill village hut. This is the first Trip Advisor review I have been compelled to write. Thank You.
reviews.title: Eclectic period property with excellent service

reviews.text: I work in travel so have been spoiled over the years but when I am paying for it myself I look for value and a high standard. This is my first TA review, that is how much I thought of this property. Heading to Lorne with two girlfriends for a weekend away I did my research and was astounded at the prices being asked at the two large well known properties in Lorne. Then I came across Grand Pacific Apartments. We had a 2 bedroom ocean view apartment for $175 per night, great price for a great apartment. Number 26, ground floor, lovely view across a lawn to the water. The living room enjoyed all the morning sun. Kitchen very well equipped with things you wouldn't usually find in an apartment eg. grater, colander, range of saucepans. Basic tea & coffee, jams & marmalades supplied. Only negatives were no mirror in the master bedroom and the bathroom fan being very noisy in the second bedroom. Staff were welcoming and professional. The hotel/apartments are located on the Wye River side of Lorne about 10 minutes walk into the main hub along a path following the beach or a made footpath. No pool but there is one in the main street next to the skate park.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Not totally sure when we checked in, lot's of very young people seemed to be running things. However, after our first night in the bar, we really got into the vibe of the place and enjoyed our stay immensely.
reviews.title: Great place, loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our apartment was fine. Not posh but everything was there, it was clean and well appointed and the view was of the holiday brochure type. Safe, underground parking was also included.
reviews.title: By: Clearclearclear -Great accommodation, friendly staff

reviews.text: A short and very picturesque 15 minute walk took you into Lorne which has lots of shops,bars and restaurants. Also what looked like a fantastic beach but not for us in October!
reviews.title: Federation style hotel with friendly local service.

reviews.text: Directly opposite the Grand Pacific, between the hotel and the pier, is a gem of a restaurant. We think it was Greek owned, the staff were absolutely brilliant and the chefs and food were outstanding. We love fresh sea food, check out our other reviews, and this place shall remain memorable for it's fantastic Rock Ling and Whiting. Eat here or waste an unforgettable opportunity.
reviews.title: A splendiferous location to feed the soul and recharge the body!

reviews.text: Finally, a mention for the bar staff at the Grand pacific. They really made us feel welcome by remembering our drinks from the night before and just being friendly, really appreciated and not common these days.
reviews.title: Hospitable and comfortable stay

reviews.text: booked this hotel and before we arrived although our room wasa king we requested a twin. they said that was fine. when we turned up though they said they didnt hae twin rooms in the hotel which i thought was strange. we then asked if the sofa in the room was a sofa bed. they replied no. and no extra linen could be offered. this was a lie...the sofa WAS a sofabed.
reviews.title: bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we then asked if the king bed was a zip-and-link bed which can be made up as a twin room. again the asnwer was no its a standard king bed. once again a lie. the king bed could become a TWIN BED. so we unzipped the bed to make a twin. and one of us has the dunna cover etc, the other had just the sheet (and a cold nights sleep).
reviews.title: Great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: real shame they had to lie. i think they were just to lazy to go up and make a twin room (the people in reception had no customer service skills whatsoever) which would have taken them 5 mins! or they just wanted to save on linen costs. take you're pick.
reviews.title: large, comfortable, well renovated

reviews.text: This is an old hotel on the outskirts of Lorne. Our large room was quite plain but comfortable and functional with TV, tea/coffee making, a small bathroom, table and chairs and a king sized bed. The ocean view from the verandah, which we could access through our window, was fantastic. We ate at the restaurant one night and found the food and prices very reasonable. Friendly staff, especially the very cheerful manager.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked mid-week for one night in a quiet month (September), not so many people in Lorne outside the summer, so we were lucky to get a big room on the top floor looking over the sea. We could go out onto the shared balcony (it is very large) by climbing out the window, which is typical for an older building like this. We ate in the restaurant, we arrived late, near closing time, but they were still able to serve us, although if we were 30 minutes later it probably wouldn't have been possible to eat here. There is no lift. We had quite a cheap price because it was off-season, so my feeling is that it was good value for money - if you pay a much higher price in the summer, you may have a different feeling about whether you are getting the best value for money. There were no unexpected charges on checkout. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Dissappointing in every respect
